content.question: ​The function <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given by <math alttext="m open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 e plus log subscript 10 open parentheses x to the power of negative 1 end exponent close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>e</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><msup><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following statements about <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is true?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is increasing, the graph of <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave up, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow negative infinity of m open parentheses x close parentheses equals space log subscript 10 e"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo> </mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​<math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is increasing, the graph of <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave down, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow 0 to the power of plus of m open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative infinity"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

<math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is decreasing, the graph of <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave up, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow 0 to the power of plus of m open parentheses x close parentheses equals infinity"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

​​<math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is decreasing, the graph of <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave down, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow negative infinity of m open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative log subscript 10 e"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>e</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is decreasing, the graph of <math alttext="m"><semantics><mi>m</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is concave up, and <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow 0 to the power of plus of m open parentheses x close parentheses equals infinity"><semantics><mrow><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><msup><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo></msup></mrow></munder><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
